div.br:
--Reminders--​​​​​​ ​ ​​​​​
School Board Meeting
April 23, 7:00 p.m. Benton Community School Board - Special Board meeting ​
This meeting will be held virtually using a speaker phone-- originated from Benton Community Central Office at 304 1st Street, Van Horne, IA - as per Iowa Code Section 21.8 which permits a governmental body to conduct a meeting by electronic means.
Board meeting Agenda - Click HERE
Meeting will be held electronically
Call: 1-312-626-6799
Meeting ID: 970 4928 7448
Accessibility:
The meeting will be held virtually using the online virtual audio conferencing tool - Zoom
Helpful videos on how to join a Zoom meeting using your cell phone, telephone, or computer
​​CLICK HERE TO VIEW VIDEO for using your computer
CLICK HERE TO VIEW VIDEO for using your cell phone or landline phone
Notice of the meeting:
Meeting location - 304 1st Street, Van Horne, IA
A physical meeting space will be made available at the Benton Community High School library if patrons elect to attend in person and want to listen to the audio stream of the meeting. Please enter the High School from the south doors near the loading dock. A school employee will be stationed there to allow you inside. Please go directly to the library.
The school district asks that you maintain a 6' social distance from other patrons.
Or patrons can use the link to the audio stream to listen to the meeting. The phone number to call in is:​​
If you have questions, please call the Benton Community School Central Office at 319-228-8701 ​Meeting minutes:
Statement will be made at the start of the meeting indicating the reason why the meeting is being held electronically -- due to heightened public health risks.
Meeting minutes will be taken and published for this meeting.
​Other REMINDERS​
Any future changes will be announced. Please check your voicemail, email, Facebook and our web page. Thank you ​Yearbook
Dear Benton Community students and families:
I hope this finds you and your family safe and healthy. I’m reaching out to you as the yearbook adviser for Benton Community High School. We are all dealing with a new normal as we try to finish the school year.
Even though events are cancelled postponed and students are not physically in the building, we still want to include activities in the yearbook and include the impact that COVID-19 has had on them. This is an unprecedented event that we want to make sure is documented in the pages of the students’ yearbook.
Because of social distancing restrictions, we are now challenged to become more creative and innovative as we finish our book this year. Therefore, we are asking all of our students and families for help. We will be reaching out with surveys and maybe asking your student for an interview via phone or email. Most importantly, we need you or your student to send photos. Please help us by participating. We want to make the best book possible and to include as many of our students as possible, but we cannot do it this year without your help.
If you are interested in sending any photos of high school students or have any questions, please forward them to dredmond@benton.k12.ia.us , but please, if you do send any photos, please make sure they are not posed per se, but are candid photos. Please include the following information as it is a requirement we have to have for the book: anyone who is in the photo has to be named with first and last name and grade level, a brief description of what is happening in the photo and where. Also, please include the first and last name of the person who took the photo for photo credit. Please make sure whatever photos are sent are in focus. Thank you for any and all help.
We truly appreciate your assistance and participation!
Sincerely,
Diane Redmond and your yearbook staff!

strong.font: (Note: State law mandates school cannot start before August 23)
